SEARCH
Package com.six.timapi

Class SubTransaction

java.lang.Object
com.six.timapi.SubTransaction
public class SubTransaction extends Object
A SubTransaction is a part of an overall transaction. Only useful in context of Swiss Post Combined transaction type. Designed to mimic the EP2 7.2. Product Record of type Record Subtrx. Specification: banking.

  • Method Details

    • getAmount

      public Amount getAmount()

      In a request defines the original amount for the transaction (given by ECR), in response the final authorized amount (given by host) in minor units.

      In a transaction request this field defines the amount in minor units that shall be authorized for this transaction.

      In a transcation response this field defines the amount in minor units that has actually been authorized. If the full amount has been authorized as sent in the transaction request, the value of the invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount> field in the request and the response is equal.

      PartialApproval: If the transaction has been approved only partially by the aquiring host, the terminal must return on SIXml the actual authorized amount that has been returned from host to terminal in the authorization response.

      Example for ep2: The ECR sends an invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount>10000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> field on SIXml to the terminal in the transaction request and the terminal sends this amount as invalid input: '<'ep2:AmtAuth>10000invalid input: '<'/ep2:AmtAuth> (=100 CHF) in the authorization request to the ep2 aquiring host. The host then only can partially approve the transaction and returns the partial approval amount invalid input: '<'ep2:AmtAuth>8000invalid input: '<'/ep2:AmtAuth> (= 80 CHF) in the authorization response to the terminal. The terminal then must return the actually approved amount back to the ECR, invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency='CHF' Exponent='2'>8000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount>

      The amount is additionally defined by the corresponding sixml:Currency and sixml:Exponent attributes. An amount can have a negative value, e.g. in case of returning a gas canister.

      Example: invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency='CHF' Exponent='2'>10000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> This is CHF 100.00

      Example: invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency='CHF' Exponent='2'>-10000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> This is CHF -100.00

      Specification: banking.

    • setAmount

      public void setAmount(Amount amount)

      In a request defines the original amount for the transaction (given by ECR), in response the final authorized amount (given by host) in minor units.

      In a transaction request this field defines the amount in minor units that shall be authorized for this transaction.

      In a transcation response this field defines the amount in minor units that has actually been authorized. If the full amount has been authorized as sent in the transaction request, the value of the invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount> field in the request and the response is equal.

      PartialApproval: If the transaction has been approved only partially by the aquiring host, the terminal must return on SIXml the actual authorized amount that has been returned from host to terminal in the authorization response.

      Example for ep2: The ECR sends an invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount>10000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> field on SIXml to the terminal in the transaction request and the terminal sends this amount as invalid input: '<'ep2:AmtAuth>10000invalid input: '<'/ep2:AmtAuth> (=100 CHF) in the authorization request to the ep2 aquiring host. The host then only can partially approve the transaction and returns the partial approval amount invalid input: '<'ep2:AmtAuth>8000invalid input: '<'/ep2:AmtAuth> (= 80 CHF) in the authorization response to the terminal. The terminal then must return the actually approved amount back to the ECR, invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency='CHF' Exponent='2'>8000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount>

      The amount is additionally defined by the corresponding sixml:Currency and sixml:Exponent attributes. An amount can have a negative value, e.g. in case of returning a gas canister.

      Example: invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency='CHF' Exponent='2'>10000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> This is CHF 100.00

      Example: invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency='CHF' Exponent='2'>-10000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> This is CHF -100.00

      Specification: banking.

    • getRate

      public Long getRate()

      DCC excange rate.

      The DCC amount (sixml:AmuntDcc) will be calculated as follows: transaction amount (sixml:Amount) / DCC rate (sixml:Rate).

      Example: invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency="EUR" Exponent="2">2000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> and the DCC currency is "CHF", the sixml:Rate="8623328" and sixml:RateExponent="7" => 20.00 EUR / 0.8623328 => 23.19 CHF

      Optional: Only in multi currency situations

      Specification: banking.

    • setRate

      public void setRate(Long rate)

      DCC excange rate.

      The DCC amount (sixml:AmuntDcc) will be calculated as follows: transaction amount (sixml:Amount) / DCC rate (sixml:Rate).

      Example: invalid input: '<'sixml:Amount Currency="EUR" Exponent="2">2000invalid input: '<'/sixml:Amount> and the DCC currency is "CHF", the sixml:Rate="8623328" and sixml:RateExponent="7" => 20.00 EUR / 0.8623328 => 23.19 CHF

      Optional: Only in multi currency situations

      Specification: banking.

    • getRateExponent

      public Long getRateExponent()

      Specifies the exponent of the dcc exchange rate.

      This field is handled like all other Exponent fields. see invalid input: '<'sixml:Exponent> for more information.

      Optional: Mandatory if

      Specification: banking.

      public void setRateExponent(Long rateExponent)

      Specifies the exponent of the dcc exchange rate.

      This field is handled like all other Exponent fields. see invalid input: '<'sixml:Exponent> for more information.

      Optional: Mandatory if

      Specification: banking.
